verses.name: Luke 24:11
verses.text: And their words seemed to them as idle tales, and they believed them not.

verses.name: Luke 24:12
verses.text: Then arose Peter, and ran unto the sepulchre; and stooping down, he beheld the linen clothes laid by themselves, and departed, wondering in himself at that which was come to pass.

verses.name: Luke 24:13
verses.text: And, behold, two of them went that same day to a village called Emmaus, which was from Jerusalem about threescore furlongs.

verses.name: Luke 24:14
verses.text: And they talked together of all these things which had happened.

verses.name: Luke 24:15
verses.text: And it came to pass, that, while they communed together and reasoned, Jesus himself drew near, and went with them.
